comment: Principle of Transfinite Recursion, part 1 of 3. Theorem 7.41(1) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 47. We start with an arbitrary class ` G ` , normally a function, and define a class ` A ` of all "acceptable" functions. The final function we're interested in is the union ` F = recs ( G ) ` of them. ` F ` is then said to be defined by transfinite recursion. The purpose of the 3 parts of this theorem is to demonstrate properties of ` F ` . In this first part we show that ` F ` is a function whose domain is all ordinal numbers. (Contributed by NM, 17-Aug-1994.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jan-2015.)
